intro: Telis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy telis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Telis pubescens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
